utterance.speaker: Tommy
utterance.content: And you're sure he didn't leave until after 9:00?

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Absolutely. We watched the Devils demolish the Rangers. The game started at 7:00.

utterance.speaker: Tommy
utterance.content: Neither of you stepped out between periods, get beer, pick up a pizza?

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: We stayed at my place. We were together the whole time.

utterance.speaker: Tommy
utterance.content: And you said the Devils won?

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Yup. 4-zip. Kovalchuk had two, Arnott and Parise each had one, and Marty got the shutout.

utterance.speaker: Tommy
utterance.content: I'm sorry. Marty?

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Martin Brodeur. Devils' starting goalie for, like, the past 20 years. He played awesome as usual.

utterance.speaker: Tommy
utterance.content: Your Honor, may I submit the sports page from the New Jersey Chronicle on October 9th, 2011.

utterance.speaker: William
utterance.content: Objection. Relevance.

utterance.speaker: Tommy
utterance.content: Goes to the witness's credibility.

utterance.speaker: Judge Foley
utterance.content: Go quickly.

utterance.speaker: Tommy
utterance.content: Would you please read the caption under the photo?

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: "Martin Brodeur stops 1 of his 36 saves on the way to a shutout victory." That's what I just said.

utterance.speaker: Tommy
utterance.content: That the defendant couldn't have possibly committed the robbery because he was with you watching Martin Brodeur shut out the Rangers.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Tommy
utterance.content: Thank you. Your Honor, may I submit the Chronicle sports page from October 10th?

utterance.speaker: William
utterance.content: Your Honor…

utterance.speaker: Judge Foley
utterance.content: This is what you call going quickly?

utterance.speaker: Tommy
utterance.content: Just two more questions. I promise.

utterance.speaker: Tommy
utterance.content: Please read the highlighted text at the bottom of the page.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: "In Sunday's sports section, New Jersey Devils goaltender Johan Hedberg was…"

utterance.speaker: Tommy
utterance.content: That's it. Keep going.

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: "Misidentified as Martin Brodeur in a photo caption and box score."

utterance.speaker: Tommy
utterance.content: An understandable mistake. Given that Martin Brodeur was scheduled to start but bowed out after taking a shot to the throat in warm-up. Which brings me to my most relevant question. Did you and the defendant spend the evening of October 8th watching the Devils game on TV, or did you just read about the game in the Chronicle while concocting this false alibi?

utterance.speaker: Mike
utterance.content: Um… I… I, um…

utterance.speaker: Tommy
utterance.content: Excuse me, Your Honor, may I approach?

utterance.speaker: Judge Foley
utterance.content: You sure you don't want to wait till after he answers your question?

utterance.speaker: Tommy
utterance.content: No. I'm gonna need a continuance.

utterance.speaker: Judge Foley
utterance.content: Now? You're one answer away from destroying their whole defense.

utterance.speaker: William
utterance.content: Come on.

utterance.speaker: Judge Foley
utterance.content: Oh, shut up. You know it's true. Let's finish this up.

utterance.speaker: Tommy
utterance.content: I can't.

utterance.speaker: Judge Foley
utterance.content: Why the hell not?

utterance.speaker: Tommy
utterance.content: Because I think I'm having a heart attack.

utterance.speaker: Judge Foley
utterance.content: Great. Call an ambulance.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Thinks he had a heart attack but didn't. His EKG, cardiac enzymes, and catheterization are all normal.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: 'Cause it's an anxiety attack. Probably because he just turned 40 and still goes by the name "Tommy".

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It's not anxiety. The E.R. Docs interviewed his wife. She confirmed he's been feeling fine. Nothing out of the ordinary at work or at home.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Probably also believes that he thinks Salma Hayek's breasts are too big.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Which is why I had them admit him anyway and treat with alprazolam. No improvements.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because…

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Because for some patients the diagnosis of anxiety disorder can actually increase anxiety, which is also why I told him he had a minor respiratory infection that was easily curable by the medication.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You lied?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I ruled out heart attack and anxiety disorder.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Interesting.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Impressive.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What, the wiliness with which Foreman ruled out anxiety or his complete wiliness-less-ness before he met me?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: The fact that you managed to smear jelly on nearly every page.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Shingles could cause chest pain before a rash appeared.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Pain would be restricted to one dermatome. It wouldn't cross them.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Asthma-induced pneumothorax would and might not show up on a posteroanterior X-ray.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No history of asthma.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: They did a lateral view as well. No sign of a pneumothorax or deep sulcus sign.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I treated an inmate once with similar symptoms after he tried to poison his cellmate with chlorine gas.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He didn't realize sharing a cell also meant sharing the air?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Chlorine gas pools near the ground he thought he'd be safe in the top bunk.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Well, why would anyone try to poison our guy?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He makes a living sending people to prison.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: But he's not in prison, and it's kind of hard to gas a guy unless you can seal him in a room first.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Which is why Arceus created a universe with 3 states of matter and 300 solid or liquid poisons that could cause his symptoms.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Arceus?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Look it up. And alkalinize his urine. Go search his home, talk to his wife, see if you can get her to tell us what she used.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Wait, why would you think his wife poisoned him?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because dangerous people don't break into your home, they live in it. And although his kids are old enough to want daddy dead, they're still to young to do anything about it.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Must be such a pleasure to live in your head.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're right. Kids might be precocious. You handle his house. You handle him and his wife.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: They get to just hang out and do nothing?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If you need help, you can take whoever you want.

utterance.speaker: Chase and Adams
utterance.content: I'll take Taub.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Interesting.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: No, it's not. It was a 50/50 choice. I'm totally fine with Taub or Park.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Cool. I'll take Taub.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: And I'll take Park.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That was fun.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Not really.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Nice move, boss. Lying to the patient.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I had no choice. I knew House wouldn't take the case unless I ruled out anxiety.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You need a girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: To keep me from lying to patients?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: To give you the excitement you need so you don't go looking for it. You're not working for House anymore, which means you no longer have him to blame if you get caught.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I'm not looking for excitement. I'm doing my job, part of which is to make sure House does his.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Girlfriend might not be so bad.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It's less dangerous than where you're headed. And that's from a guy with one alimony and two child support payments.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: It's this new curve control thing. It automatically slows the car when it senses I'm taking a curve too fast.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: You really think I care about your car? Or are you just trying to avoid talking about why you don't like working with me?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: There's nothing to talk about. House liked poking ant hills with a stick when he was a kid, and now he wants to do the same with us.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: House is an ass, but he's an intuitive ass. He obviously noticed something.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Yeah, the fact that we work well together. He thrives on conflict and is looking for someone to torment. Don't let it be us.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Why would they thank him?

utterance.speaker: Olivia
utterance.content: Because he doesn't treat them like scum. He makes them feel like he's helping by offering a plea or even just by letting them pay their debt and clear their conscience. And even if someone wanted to poison him, I don't see how they would do it. He never eats or drinks anything that we haven't made at home.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Wait. You mean literally? Like, not even a bottle of water?

utterance.speaker: Olivia
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: So he was obviously afraid of something.

utterance.speaker: Olivia
utterance.content: Yeah, rats, mice, cockroaches.

utterance.speaker: Tommy
utterance.content: My first job out of law school was at the health department. If you'd have seen some of the kitchens or the processing plants I have, you'd cook all your own food too.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Poison wouldn't have to be in food. Have you gotten any strange letters or packages recently?

utterance.speaker: Tommy
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You also wouldn't have to be at work.

utterance.speaker: Tommy
utterance.content: We've got two young kids. There's definitely no poisons I could have accidentally been exposed to at home.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What if it wasn't an accident? How are things between you and your wife?

utterance.speaker: Tommy
utterance.content: Are you asking me if I think my wife is trying to kill me?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Yes, I am.

utterance.speaker: Tommy
utterance.content: Absolutely not. This is coming from a man whose eyes are wide open. I have prosecuted hundreds of despicable acts by husbands, wives, parents. I can assure you…

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: No pesticides, fertilizers, or fuel in the garage. You find anything?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Maybe we should look again.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Maybe we should leave before the police get here.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Well, even if a neighbor saw us break in and called 911, unless they said we were armed, it's low priority. We've got another five minutes.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: He's a prosecutor. Obviously he knows a lot of cops. His house is not gonna be low priority.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Good point.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Wait. The dining room's on the other side of that wall.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Yeah, so?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: But it ends, like, three feet further over.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: You've got to be kidding me. A second ago, you wanted to run like hell, and now you want to look for secret passages?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: There's a magnet on the fridge they use to open child-proofed cabinets. Go get it. Hurry up.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Here.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Holy crap.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Don't tell me. The jealous wife in the dining room with bipyridyl herbicide.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: We didn't find any poisons.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, you obviously found something.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Or break into it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cool.

utterance.speaker: Olivia
utterance.content: That's impossible. You must have broken into the wrong house.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Then you have creepy neighbors, because there were photos of you and your kids all over.

utterance.speaker: Olivia
utterance.content: I-I don't understand. How could this…

utterance.speaker: Tommy
utterance.content: I had it put in during the remodel last year.

utterance.speaker: Olivia
utterance.content: But we went over the plans together.

utterance.speaker: Tommy
utterance.content: It's not in the plans. I didn't want the city to know about it. I'm sorry. I should have told you. I just… I didn't want you and the kids to worry.

utterance.speaker: Olivia
utterance.content: About what? Tommy, what is it? Why would you think you needed so many guns?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: You're not gonna believe this.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Imperio absenti chaos regit. He's worried that "too big to fail" applies to our banks but not our government.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: How'd you know?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because that's what every idiot with a bunker full of assault rifles is scared of. Heather Sweeney. Uh, it'll just be a couple of minutes till someone's ready to see you.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Maybe it's not stupidity. It's a symptom. Cocaine abuse can cause paranoia and chest pain.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: This isn't necessarily paranoia. Societies do fall apart. Look what happened with London and the riots.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: There's a difference between an isolated riot and the fall of civilization.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: April Donaldson. Sorry. Misspoke.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Imagine what would happen if there was a terrorist attack on the food supply or a pandemic where we had to ration antibiotics.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: That's ridiculous.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Ouch.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Oh, shut up. We know what you're trying to do, and it's not gonna work.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: It was a little harsh.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Stop being so…

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: What? Paranoid?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're gonna look pretty foolish if that was the wrong guess.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I think you're a good person and a fine doctor, but it's ridiculous to think anyone needs an arsenal of assault weapons, he's obviously paranoid. What about Fahr's disease?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: He's not hallucinating.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: As far as we know. We should do a mental status examination and get a CT of his basal ganglia.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: No, we shouldn't. If it's not poison, it's most likely atrial fibrillation brought on by hyperthyroidism or sleep apnea.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Looks like we got ourselves a good, ol'-fashioned cat fight.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: No, we don't. We have a reasoned disagreement.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Still there's only one way to settle this. Actually there's two, but we don't have enough Jell-O for the first. Mini-mental, CT, and get a hair sample to check for past cocaine use. Check his TSH levels and get a sleep study. Sorry, we got to make it a fair fight, which means you're stuck with her.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: He's not "stuck" with me.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: And it's not a fight.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Uh, excuse me, miss, what is your name?

utterance.speaker: Lady
utterance.content: Mariel Wilkerson.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Huh. You don't look like a Mariel. You're up.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: So what do you think — is the patient paranoid or am I?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I don't think stockpiling weapons is the most reasoned response, but, given what I've seen at Bloomingdale's on Black Friday, I wouldn't say it rises to the level of mental illness.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: And me?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Again, given what I've seen at Bloomingdale's… Don't let House get to you.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: It's all of you. I feel like you don't respect me. Chase certainly doesn't try to hide it.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Chase respects you. He's just more comfortable working with me because he's known me longer. And I'm not just saying that because you own a gun.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I don't own a gun. I've thought about it, but I'd probably end up shooting someone in my own family, like when my brother tosses his toenail clippings behind the couch. What about you?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: If anarchy breaks out, I plan to do what my ancestors have done throughout the ages — run.

utterance.speaker: Forman
utterance.content: Stop telling the nurses I'm looking for a girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: What makes you—

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Two lunch offers and a box of cupcakes since this morning.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: So a few people are nice to you, and your first thought is, "Hmm, this seems strange." I haven't even had enough time to eat my own lunch, much less run around trying to recruit nurses for you. So, can I get back to work?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: You're lying, aren't you?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It's for his own good.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He's not paranoid. He's just stupid.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Well, shouldn't you put yourself in that group? You own a gun.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Our patient doesn't own a gun. He owns an arsenal. And I don't own a gun.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yes, you do. And you're a felon, so you'll end up back in jail—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That is actually not one of the many reasons that I don't own a gun. Why would I need a gun? The only thing I own worth protecting a thief would need a crane to get out of my apartment.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You don't own anything you need. You own things you want. And you're definitely the type who'd want a gun. You like anything dangerous — monster trucks, motorcycles, fireworks.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Everyone loves fireworks.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Watching them, not making them.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm telling the truth.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I stand corrected.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If you believe me, then this issue will be resolved with no further action necessary.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Absolutely.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's not resolved, is it?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Not even close.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's not cocaine. Hair samples were clean.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: It's not looking good for Fahr's either. I'm not seeing any calcifications.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You sure? They can be pretty hard to detect in people under 50.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: See?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: We all disagree all the time. It's not just me and Park.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Nice try, but I'm not getting in the middle.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: So why didn't you want to go with her this morning?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: She's weird.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: She's not weird. She's a good doctor.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Most good doctors are weird. Look at House.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Am I weird?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Yeah, but you're hot, so it's easier to put up with. You're completely normal and a pleasure to deal with.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: You're weird.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: In a good way?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Maybe we should just concentrate on the medicine.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You own any guns?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: That's not medicine.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: But it's related to medicine. Kind of.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: What do you think?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Yeah, but not for protection. Despite what the media would have us believe, you think we live in a very safe world. You just think they're fun.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: How did you know?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Working in prison, you learned criminals rarely target random strangers, and you've got more money than you know what to do with, so anything that seems different and fun's worth trying.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: And you?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Not here in the States. Back home, I keep a few for hunting 'roos.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: You hunt kangaroos? But they're so cute.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: They're also delicious.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: You're screwing with me.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Totally. There's no calcification. Looks like we're both wrong.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: You don't need to stay. We won't have the results until the morning.

utterance.speaker: Olivia
utterance.content: It's okay. I'll stay.

utterance.speaker: Tommy
utterance.content: Go. I'm sure your mother's ready for a break by now, huh? Give the kids a kiss for me.

utterance.speaker: Olivia
utterance.content: You think it's the end of the world, but you wanted kids.

utterance.speaker: Tommy
utterance.content: Oh, honey, come on. I don't think the world's coming to an end. Look… You have a spare tire in your car, right? That's what those guns are. I mean, I hope to God I never have to use one. But if we can wake up and learn that the entire bank system has gone bankrupt overnight, it just seems stupid not to have a jack in the trunk. Just in case.

utterance.speaker: Olivia
utterance.content: And you've always—

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: What's that from?

utterance.speaker: Tommy
utterance.content: I don't know.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: You don't feel that?

utterance.speaker: Tommy
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: He also spiked a fever overnight. It could be TB.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You want to say it?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Say what?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: There's no sign of atelectasis or infiltrates on the chest X-ray.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah. It's med-speak for she's an idiot.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Systemic sclerosis can cause lower extremity ulcers.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: It would have to be pretty far along. His first symptom was just a few days ago.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: His paranoia started at least a year ago.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: If he's paranoid.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So it's either not sclerosis or it's extremely aggressive sclerosis.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We should biopsy the skin lesion and start him on enoxaparin.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Shouldn't we wait for the biopsy results before we start treatment?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Now's your chance. She's leading with her chin.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I agree with her.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, you don't. Which means you're both idiots. Get to work.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I know you don't think I'm an idiot.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Does it matter?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: If you're just looking to amuse yourself at my expense, then no. But if you feel the need to manipulate me to make me useful, then yes. I thought we'd gotten past that.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If we hadn't gotten past that, you wouldn't be here. But ability isn't always enough. Just ask Yngwie Malmsteen.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: So this is you trying to help me?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, this is me helping me. And amusing myself at your expense. Which brings us back to, why do you care?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I deserve respect. I'm a good doctor.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: People respect you. They just don't like you.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Where's your wife?

utterance.speaker: Tommy
utterance.content: She just needed some time.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Not a fan of guns I take it.

utterance.speaker: Tommy
utterance.content: It's not the guns. It's… I shouldn't have lied about it.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'm guessing it's a little of both. And a little of, "Who the hell is this guy?"

utterance.speaker: Tommy
utterance.content: I'm not a nutcase. I just want to do everything I can to protect my family.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Don't worry. I'm sure she’ll understand.

utterance.speaker: Guy in the clinic
utterance.content: At first, I thought it might be frostbite, but I haven't really been out in the cold.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And yet your first thought was frostbite?

utterance.speaker: Guy
utterance.content: Yeah, I guess I was just going by how it looks.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It looks absolutely nothing like frostbite.

utterance.speaker: Guy
utterance.content: You serious?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: With some difficulty.

utterance.speaker: Guy
utterance.content: Then what is it?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: A sign that you need to take a long vacation. At least a month.

utterance.speaker: Guy
utterance.content: A vacation? Wait, is this like a bucket list thing? It's cancer…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's silver. I'm guessing silver nitrate mixed with petroleum jelly that your boss put on the petty cash so he'd know who to have arrested for stealing it.

utterance.speaker: Guy
utterance.content: Damn.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, damn. It's diffused into your skin, and the only way to get rid of it is to get new skin. That normally happens every 30 days. So, I hear that La Crosse, Wisconsin has got the world's largest beer can.

utterance.speaker: Regina
utterance.content: Here's the per diem schedules.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: These are supposed to be in the computer files.

utterance.speaker: Regina
utterance.content: Sorry. Since Claudine left, no one's been inputting the numbers.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I miss Claudine.

utterance.speaker: Regina
utterance.content: She left because of you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I thought that was Nadine.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Emergency page takes precedence.

utterance.speaker: Regina
utterance.content: I don't know how to use the program.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Then find someone who does. I got to get out of here.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Got your page.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You're an ass.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Admit it.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Let me down.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: After you admit it. You know, I'm a little tired. I think I'm gonna—

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: All right, I admit it. Despite the fact that I know there's a gun in here, I'd never find it because you are more devious—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Clever.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Devious.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: All right, fine, clever. More clever and you'll always be one step ahead of me.

utterance.speaker: Anita
utterance.content: You're either preparing to fight Pacquiao or you're having one heck of a bad day. I'm Anita.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Eric. Nice to meet you. And you can tell Taub that he's gonna get the same treatment as this heavy bag if he doesn't cut this crap out.

utterance.speaker: Anita
utterance.content: Who's Taub?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You know, I'm sure you're a nice person and you have no idea what you've gotten sucked into, but, really, I'm not interested.

utterance.speaker: Anita
utterance.content: Okay, and I'm sure you're a nice person, but I just moved from Atlanta, and it's my first time at this gym, so definitely don't know who this Taub guy is, but I already agree. He's a jerk. Are you sure you don't want to start over? Take your time. I'll be around.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Taub, it's Foreman.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I can't talk now, I’m a little busy.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What's going on?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Need some droperidol in here!

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I gotta go!

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He was hallucinating he was being attacked by bears.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Points again to paranoia.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I agree. Except for the "again". Acute onset points to tularemia.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Or it's been chronic, which points to GAD autoimmunity. Explains the neurological impairment as well as the normal blood work.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Tularemia doesn't always show up in blood work either.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You know what else doesn't show up in the blood work? Nothing. This could be all psychiatric. An untreated schizoid disorder he's finally lost the ability to suppress.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Schizophrenia doesn't cause skin ulcers or fevers.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: No, but digging delusions out of your skin with dirty fingernails could cause both.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I don't think he's a psych case.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because you're paranoid about paranoia.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Because his symptoms point towards an infection that spread to his brain. I think we should treat with high-dose, broad-spectrum—

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: which will kill him if it's a GAD autoimmunity.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Treat for GAD. Corticosteroids and IV immunoglobulin.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I'm not paranoid. And they don't dislike me. They don't even really know me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: They tell you that?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I didn't ask because you wouldn't believe the answer.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It makes you feel better to think that.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: You're the one everyone dislikes. You probably don't even think it's GAD. You're just agreeing with her because you think it'll create more conflict between us.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: There's only one way to find out. Actually, there's two but we're still waiting for that Jell-O delivery. Let me know how it goes.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Gotcha!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You poor dumb bastard.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Touché.

utterance.speaker: Anita
utterance.content: Mm. God, this is exactly what I needed.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Tell me about it.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Oh my God. Who is that, your roommate?

utterance.speaker: Anita
utterance.content: It's just you have to go.

utterance.speaker: Anita
utterance.content: Please. I'll explain later. Just hurry up. Please.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You have a boyfriend?

utterance.speaker: Anita
utterance.content: No, he's not my boyfriend. He's my husband. I'm really sorry.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: His fever's going through the roof, which means we were wrong about GAD and the steroids kicked the infection into high gear.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Or it's GAD, and we started treatment too late.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Increase the steroid dose.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: We can't. If it's an infection, we'll kill him for sure.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: With neurological symptoms progressing this fast, he's dead either way. If we increase the steroids, then either death comes slower, which means we were too late with the GAD, or death comes faster, which means we were too stupid with the infection.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: We were already stupid with the infection, but it's not too late. He's young, and he was perfectly healthy two days ago. He can fight this off if we give him a chance.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Fine. But a shotgun is not gonna work. We need a sniper rifle. Start running DNA assays for sporotrichosis, meningococcemia, and any other boggle-winning words you can think of.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: You just said you wanted to increase the steroids, and now you want to just—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I changed my mind.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: But—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Do what Park says.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Well, you don't have a gun, but you do have my sunglasses, my tennis racket — I can't imagine why…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Had to kill a mouse. It was really hard with those stupid little sunglasses.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: And my money clip.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Was there any money in it?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Not anymore.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Can I go to bed now? Or do you want to do a cavity search? Lock up on your way out.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: This is ridiculous. Every moment we waste looking for a phantom infection is time we could be treating him.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: For the wrong diagnosis. If it was GAD, he'd be having seizures.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: If it was infection, there would be some sign of it in his blood or CNS. Which there isn't.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Yet.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'm beginning to think we should just go with House's idea.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: This was House's idea. He said—

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: No, I'm talking about the Jell-O. At least it wouldn't be so annoying to watch.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: What's the problem? Some cute young nurse baked you cookies?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No, some guy almost caught me making out with his wife in their living room.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: And how exactly is that my fault?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: If you hadn't been screwing with me and put the idea in my head…

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: So you don't date anyone unless I put the idea in your head. You really do need psychiatric help.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Unlike you, I don't need drama. I like my job, and I'm happy with my life.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You're so happy with your life you've got nothing better to do at midnight than to come back into work to yell at me?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Stay out of my business.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You're blaming the wrong guy! Good for him. Married one's not a keeper, but it's a start.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You're an idiot.

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: He has stridor but no obstruction.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He's anaphylaxing. Get me a trach kit. Scalpel. It's not working. There's no breath sounds. It doesn't make any sense.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: His trachea's blocked below the incision point. We need racemic epinephrine.

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: We tried that already.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We're gonna try again. It's our only choice.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We got him breathing, but barely.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: At least we know tracheal edema isn't from anything we did because we're not doing anything.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Which is a good thing, because neither GAD nor systemic infection would cause anaphylaxis or tracheal edema.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: And an allergic reaction wouldn't get worse three days after he was admitted.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: So we've got nothing.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Unless he was still being poisoned.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: By who? His wife wasn't even here when he hallucinated.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Good question.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Now we're the ones being paranoid.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: What about squamous cell carcinoma? If it's only in his epithelium, it wouldn't show up in his chest X-ray.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It is possible, but…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wouldn't cause hallucinations.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: It could if you also have paraneoplastic syndrome.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Get a biopsy.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You think it's cancer?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I think you should get a biopsy.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Admit it. Two hours ago, I found this in your closet in a box with your name on it. I knew you'd move it somewhere outside your apartment until you were certain I'd given up looking. So I had to convince you that I'd given up looking.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That’s not a gun.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yes, it's a paperweight with a handy storage compartment for .45-caliber bullets.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And that's not a bullet.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Admit it. I'm more clever and more devious. You can even have it back. It's not my problem if you go back to prison. My problem is you thinking you're always one step ahead of me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: This proves nothing because it's not a gun. It's a prop. From Dorothy Dietrich's magic act. Look it up. She's the only woman to ever do the "Catch a Bullet" trick. I won this off her prop master in a poker game.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: House—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's fake! It's plugged. Look for yourself.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Hey, hey, don't point that thing at me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's not dangerous because it's not a gun.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: House, House, just stop it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Fine.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: What the hell are you doing?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Pull the trigger.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Don't be insane.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: They're blanks. You pull the trigger, I drool a little fake blood, and then I spit out the bullet that the audience thinks I caught in my teeth. Go ahead. Shoot me.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'm not shooting you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: All right. I'll shoot you.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Don't. House, don't. Even if they are blanks, people'll freak.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's not real. Which means you didn't prove that I have a gun. Which means you proved nothing. Admit it. Admit it.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: All right, what?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You win.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And it feels good.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Grr.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You were wrong. Don't feel too bad. We all were. His trachea wasn't swollen. It was blocked by a pseudomembrane growing across it. It means he's not paranoid, he’s an idiot, and was poisoned.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Give me a Machida scope. Hold his legs. He's not gonna like this. Because you're not gonna be able to breathe. But I need to see down your barrel. Good news is the poison didn't come from your wife. It came from a little bastard of a bacterium whose crap can cause chest pain, respiratory distress, skin ulcers, the growth of pseudomembrane across the airway, and, in very rare cases, hallucinations. Call the CDC. Tell them we need antitoxin as soon as possible.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Diphtheria?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We didn't guess it because nobody gets it. Instead of building bunkers, you should be getting boosters. As in routine vaccines against stuff that is actually scary.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Diphtheria.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: House pulled it out of nowhere.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Cool.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You just getting in?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Had a meeting about a new parking validation system.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Cool.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: How are you feeling?

utterance.speaker: Tommy
utterance.content: Not great. But better.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: The antitoxin is working. He'll be able to go home in a few days.

utterance.speaker: Olivia
utterance.content: That's good news. But we've moved out.

utterance.speaker: Tommy
utterance.content: Oh, come on, honey. I'm sorry I lied, but—

utterance.speaker: Olivia
utterance.content: I know, okay. It was for our own good, but I don't care. I don't want to be lied to, and I can't live like that. I can't live in that home.

utterance.speaker: Tommy
utterance.content: Oh, please don't. I love you.

utterance.speaker: Olivia
utterance.content: I love you too. Which is why you're not gonna live there either. I don't care if we might need them. I just know that I can't live my life feeling like we do. It's not worth living in fear.

utterance.speaker: Tommy
utterance.content: Okay. I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Regina
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Regina
utterance.content: You know, there's a bunch of us going to happy hour after work. I'm craving nachos. You interested?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Thanks, but I got a lot of work I need to get done.

utterance.speaker: Regina
utterance.content: Sure. Well, if you change your mind, we'll be at Rudy's.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Would you like to get a drink sometime after work?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You mean all of us or just us?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I was thinking just the two of us.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Did Taub put you up to this?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: No, it was just something I'd been thinking about and I figured what the heck? Might as well ask.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Yeah, well, it's probably not a good idea, you know, with us working together.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Didn't you marry someone you used to work with?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Yeah, but it… All right. Sure. When?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Tonight?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Hey. Changed my mind. Okay.

utterance.speaker: Anita
utterance.content: I'm glad you changed your mind.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Hey.
